q: The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.
h:
“The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
h:
“Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Embrace the life you have and stop wishing that you could be someone else.
h:
“Embrace the life you have and stop wishing that you could be someone else.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
h:
“When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.” —
Walt Disney

q: The older you get, the more you understand how your conscience works.
h:
“The older you get, the more you understand how your conscience works.” —
Criss Jami

q: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
h:
“A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
h:
“Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.” —
Carl Bard

q: My powers are ordinary. Only my application brings me success.
h:
“My powers are ordinary. Only my application brings me success.” —
Isaac Newton

q: The best dreams happen when you're awake.
h:
“The best dreams happen when you're awake.” —
Cherie Gilderbloom

q: To bear trials with a calm mind robs misfortune of its strength and burden.
h:
“To bear trials with a calm mind robs misfortune of its strength and burden.” —
Seneca

q: True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.
h:
“True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.” —
Og Mandino

q: You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.
h:
“You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: If we know how to adapt, we end up being superior.
h:
“If we know how to adapt, we end up being superior.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing.
h:
“When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing. ” —
Zen Proverb

q: Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.
h:
“Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Nothing good ever comes of violence.
h:
“Nothing good ever comes of violence.” —
Martin Luther

q: The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.
h:
“The only way it gets better for you is when you get better. Better is not something you wish, it's something you become.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The more we value things, the less we value ourselves.
h:
“The more we value things, the less we value ourselves. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.
h:
“Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
h:
“Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.” —
Aristotle

q: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
h:
“Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —
George Addair

q: The Art of Peace begins with you.
h:
“The Art of Peace begins with you.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: What gets measured gets improved.
h:
“What gets measured gets improved.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Even if you persuade me, you won't persuade me.
h:
“Even if you persuade me, you won't persuade me.” —
Aristophanes

q: The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic.
h:
“The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic. ” —
Woody Allen

q: Success and failure come and go, but don't let them define you. It's who you are that matters.
h:
“Success and failure come and go, but don't let them define you. It's who you are that matters.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.
h:
“Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own. Imagination is a force that can actually manifest a reality.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own. Imagination is a force that can actually manifest a reality.” —
James Cameron

q: Be polite to all, but intimate with few.
h:
“Be polite to all, but intimate with few.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Peace is letting it be. Letting life flow, letting emotions flow through you.
h:
“Peace is letting it be. Letting life flow, letting emotions flow through you.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness but it is greatness.
h:
“Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness but it is greatness.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: There is no failure except in no longer trying. There is no defeat except from within, no insurmountable barrier except our own inherent weakness of purpose.
h:
“There is no failure except in no longer trying. There is no defeat except from within, no insurmountable barrier except our own inherent weakness of purpose.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
h:
“What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.
h:
“The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: There is no right or wrong, only a series of possibilities that shift with each thought, feeling, and action that you experience.
h:
“There is no right or wrong, only a series of possibilities that shift with each thought, feeling, and action that you experience.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: If someone betrays you once, it's their fault; if they betray you twice, it's your fault.
h:
“If someone betrays you once, it's their fault; if they betray you twice, it's your fault.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
h:
“Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.” —
Helen Keller

q: Our view of the world is truly shaped by what we decide to hear.
h:
“Our view of the world is truly shaped by what we decide to hear.” —
William James

q: So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.
h:
“So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.
h:
“The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.
h:
“Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.
h:
“Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.
h:
“A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.” —
Osho

q: A mentor is someone who sees more talent and ability within you, than you see in yourself, and helps bring it out of you.
h:
“A mentor is someone who sees more talent and ability within you, than you see in yourself, and helps bring it out of you.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
h:
“Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: The world is open for play, everything and everybody is mockable in a wonderful way.
h:
“The world is open for play, everything and everybody is mockable in a wonderful way.” —
Robin Williams

q: There exists only the present instant; a Now which always and without end is itself new.
h:
“There exists only the present instant; a Now which always and without end is itself new.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Challenge yourself to find the good and beautiful thing inside of everyone.
h:
“Challenge yourself to find the good and beautiful thing inside of everyone.” —
Mark Manson

q: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.
h:
“You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: From morning till night, we should never rely on a single thing.
h:
“From morning till night, we should never rely on a single thing.” —
Huang Po
